code_vnit: Nitrification rate dependence on NH4: 1 = the nitrification rate is proportional to NH4 concentration ; 2 = the nitrification rate depends on NH4 concentration according to a Michaelis-Menten function (saturation)
code_tnit: Temperature function for nitrification: 1 = piecewise linear function ; 2 = gaussian function
code_rationit: Nitrification N20 ratio: 1 = constant ratio (parameter) ; 2 = variable ratio according to soil water filled pore space (WFPS)
code_hourly_wfps_nit: Hourly WFPS calculation for nitrification: 1 = calculation of the hourly evolution of soil WFPS for days with rainfall ; 2 = option disabled
code_pdenit: Denitrification potential: 1 = constant potential (parameter) ; 2 = potential estimated from soil organic C content
code_ratiodenit: Denitrification N20 ratio: 1 = constant ratio (parameter) ; 2 = variable ratio according to pH, soil WFPS, NO3 concentration
code_hourly_wfps_denit: Hourly WFPS calculation for denitrification: 1 = calculation of the hourly evolution of soil WFPS for days with rainfall ; 2 = option disabled
hminn: fraction of the soil water content at field capacity below which the nitrification is zero
hoptn: fraction of the soil water content at field capacity above which nitrification is optimal
pHminnit: pH below which nitrification is zero
pHmaxnit: pH above which nitrification is optimal
nh4_min: minimum soil ammonium content (fixed ammonium, not available for nitrification)
pHminden: pH below which denitrification only produces N2O (for a soil WFPS of ~80%)
pHmaxden: pH above which denitrification only produces N2 (for a soil WFPS of ~80%)
wfpsc: soil WFPS threshold beyond which denitrification is active, and more generally beyond which anaerobic conditions become significant
scale_tdenitopt: parameter controlling the range of temperature favourable to denitrification
Kd: half saturation constant for the function relating the NO3 concentration to the denitrification rate. Multiplying by gravimetric soil water content yields mg NO3-N/kg soil
k_desat: constant controlling the rate of desaturation of a soil layer (Hourly WFPS option enabled). A value of 3.0 allows 95% of the water to be drained in one day and thus to reach a soil water content very close to field capacity
fnx: potential nitrification rate expressed as the fraction of available ammonium nitrified in one day (linear option for nitrification rate)
vnitmax: nitrification potential (Michaelis-Menten option for nitrification rate)
Kamm: half saturation constant for the function relating NH4 concentration to nitrification rate (Michaelis-Menten option for nitrification rate). Multiplying by gravimetric soil water content yields mg NH4-N/kg soil
tnitmin: temperature below which nitrification is zero (option piecewise linear function)
tnitopt: temperature above which nitrification is optimal (option piecewise linear function)
tnitop2: temperature above which nitrification begins to decrease after the optimum (option piecewise linear function)
tnitmax: temperature above which nitrification is zero (option piecewise linear function)
tnitopt_gauss: optimum temperature for nitrification (if gaussian function option enabled)
scale_tnitopt: parameter controlling the range of temperature favourable to nitrification (if gaussian function option enabled)
rationit: proportion of nitrified nitrogen emitted as N2O (if constant ratio option enabled)
cmin_pdenit: organic carbon content below which the denitrification potential is minimal (option calculation of the denitrification potential enabled)
cmax_pdenit: organic carbon content above which the denitrification potential is maximum (option calculation of the denitrification potential enabled)
min_pdenit: minimum value of denitrification potential (option calculation of denitrification potential enabled)
max_pdenit: maximum value of denitrification potential (option calculation of denitrification potential enabled)
ratiodenit: proportion of denitrified nitrogen emitted as N2O (if constant ratio option enabled)
profdenit: maximum soil depth affected by denitrification
vpotdenit: denitrification potential (constant potential option) over soil thickness defined by profdenit
